title: Basic
description: This schema defines basic types that are used by other test schemas.

columnTestSummaryDefinition.description: Schema to capture test case execution summary at the column level.

success.description: Number of test cases that passed.

failed.description: Number of test cases that failed.

aborted.description: Number of test cases that aborted.

queued.description: Number of test cases that are queued for execution.

testSummary.description: Schema to capture test case execution summary.

success.description: Number of test cases that passed.

failed.description: Number of test cases that failed.

aborted.description: Number of test cases that aborted.

queued.description: Number of test cases that are queued for execution.

testResultValue.description: Schema to capture test case result values.

testCaseResult.description: Schema to capture test case result.

id.description: Unique identifier of this failure instance

testCaseFQN.description: Fully qualified name of the test case.

timestamp.description: Data one which test case result is taken.

sampleData.description: sample data to capture rows/columns that didn't match the expressed testcase.

incidentId.description: Incident State ID associated with this result. This association happens when the result is created, and will stay there even when the incident is resolved.

maxBound.description: Upper bound limit for the test case result as defined in the test definition.

minBound.description: Lower bound limit for the test case result as defined in the test definition.

testCase.description: Test case that this result is for.

testDefinition.description: Test definition that this result is for.

dimensionResults.description: List of dimensional test results. Only populated when the test case has dimensionColumns specified.

testSuiteExecutionFrequency.description: How often the test case should run.

dimensionValue.description: A single dimension name-value pair for dimensional test results

testCaseDimensionResult.description: Test case result for dimensional analysis - supports both single and multi-dimensional groupings

id.description: Unique identifier of this dimensional result instance

testCaseResultId.description: Reference to the parent TestCaseResult execution that generated this dimensional result

testCase.description: Reference to the test case for efficient querying of dimensional time series

timestamp.description: Timestamp when the dimensional test result was captured (same as parent TestCaseResult)

dimensionValues.description: Array of dimension name-value pairs for this result (e.g., [{'name': 'region', 'value': 'mumbai'}, {'name': 'product', 'value': 'laptop'}])

dimensionKey.description: Composite key for API filtering: 'region=mumbai' or 'region=mumbai,product=laptop'

testCaseStatus.description: Status of the test for this dimension combination

result.description: Details of test case results for this dimension combination

testResultValue.description: Test result values for this dimension combination

passedRows.description: Number of rows that passed for this dimension combination

failedRows.description: Number of rows that failed for this dimension combination

passedRowsPercentage.description: Percentage of rows that passed for this dimension combination

failedRowsPercentage.description: Percentage of rows that failed for this dimension combination

impactScore.description: Impact score indicating the significance of this dimension for revealing data quality variations. Higher scores indicate dimensions with more significant quality issues considering both failure rate and data volume.
